channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meta’s investors are worried about the billions it’s spending on AI—but its advertising empire makes it a positive, Deutsche Bank says
item.description: Investors balk at $40 billion in spending, sending stock falling—but analysts say Meta’s advertising advantage is a perfect use case for AI.

item.title: All the data so far is showing inflation isn't going away, and is making things tough on the Fed
item.description: The last batch of inflation news that Federal Reserve officials will see before their meeting next week is in, and none of it is very good.

item.title: With inflation still high and economic growth slowing sharply we could be heading toward stagflation, a scenario 'nobody is really prepared for,' UBS exec says
item.description: After preparing for a recession, and hoping for a soft landing, the U.S. might end up in an unexpected bout of stagflation.

item.title: Dividend stocks are poised to outperform, says Bank of America. Here are names on its list
item.description: History shows in this economic environment, dividend stocks have led the way higher a majority of the time, Bank of America's Savita Subramanian said.

item.title: Buffett-owned real estate brokerage pays $250 million to settle claims that agent commissions break antitrust law
item.description: HomeServices of America is the latest to settle a Missouri lawsuit filed on behalf of homebuyers.

item.title: Federal regulator finds Tesla Autopilot has 'critical safety gap' linked to hundreds of collisions
item.description: Federal authorities say a "critical safety gap" in Tesla's Autopilot system contributed to at least 467 collisions, 13 resulting in fatalities.

item.title: Tesla’s Elon Musk speeds past Mark Zuckerberg on the billionaires list after Meta stock plummets on its cash-sucking AI plans
item.description: Zuckerberg passed Musk on the list earlier this month.

item.title: Intel used to dominate the U.S. chip industry. Now it's struggling to stay relevant
item.description: Intel has missed most of the significant technology transitions over the past 15-plus years, losing its standing in the chip industry along the way.

item.title: It’s still a golden age of homebuilding, according to one top real estate CEO. Here’s why
item.description: “It’s that unique confluence of strong demand, no supply because there’s no resale inventory, and large public builders with a meaningful advantage through those rate buydowns,” Howard Hughes’ chief executive said.

item.title: FAFSA delays could have some students thinking about a gap year—3 factors to consider before you do
item.description: Plenty of students take a year off before college. But these three situations could impact your decision.
